title: Telescope Setup Basics
description: Set up a small telescope, align the finder, and stabilize your tripod.
tldr: Level the tripod, align the finder on a distant object, and keep your scope balanced for smoother tracking.

sections.title: Tripod stability
sections.body: Level the tripod and tighten all joints. Stability reduces shaky views and frustration.

sections.title: Finder alignment
sections.body: Aim at a distant object in daylight, center it in the main scope, then align the finder.

sections.title: Balance check
sections.body: Ensure the scope is balanced so it moves smoothly without drifting.

quiz.question: When should you align the finder?
quiz.explanation: Daylight alignment is easier and accurate.
